definition: to use one's brain
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
brain/mind/head/essence
to use one's brains/to think

sentences.english: His mind reached after an understanding of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他開動腦筋，想弄懂這個問題。
不動腦子，我就活不下去。

sentences.english: Using your head, you'll find a good way.
sentences.chinese: 動動腦，你就會想出一個好辦法。

sentences.english: You must use your own head.
Encourage students to think more, and be more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵學生在學習中多動腦，更自覺主動的學習。

sentences.english: Because I follow a classic pattern, the coding is almost brainless.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我沿用了經典模式，因此編碼幾乎不用動腦子。

sentences.english: So I need to do something intelligent to exercise my brain.
sentences.chinese: 所以我得做點開動腦筋的事情讓大腦也得到鍛鍊。
開動腦筋，爲劇本想些點子。

sentences.english: Solve your urgent problems with a little creativity.
sentences.chinese: 所以在解決緊急問題時動動腦筋。

sentences.english: The second was not to rush unthinkingly to grab a small profit.
sentences.chinese: 第二個教訓是不要不動腦筋地急於抓住蠅頭小利。
這些生意是最不需要動腦子的。

sentences.english: Just like body health depends on exercise, psychology health should depend on the activity of brain.
sentences.chinese: 和鍛鍊身體一樣，“腦”健康就要活動腦。

sentences.english: Other research shows that people with spring birthdays like to exercise their minds.
sentences.chinese: 還有其它研究指出春天出生的人喜歡動腦。

sentences.english: You haven't used your noodle, so you got ripped-off.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你沒有動腦子，所以就被人家騙了。

sentences.english: They seldom labour their wits on thankless task.
sentences.chinese: 他們很少爲喫力不討好的工作動腦筋。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to take up time/to spend time
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to blame/to rebuke
to do what one is told/obedient
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
household duties/housework
to act recklessly/to mess around
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
about a year
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
timidity/timid/cowardly
to do sth in place of sb else
to spend (money or time)
